titleStmt.title: The true every man & woman their own doctor: or, a salve for every sore Being a book full of rare receipts for the most dangerous distempers incident to the bodies of men, women and children; and is very fit to be in all families against any time of sickness, gathered out of the library of that famous traveller Dr. Ponteus and now publish'd for the good and benefit of the kingdom; and being nothing but what is experienced by many thousands of people in city and country, doing good to many. Don't read only but practice also, then speak as you find; and give God the praise in all things. With six most excellent receipts for all sorts of cattle whatsoever. Licensed according to order.
titleStmt.author: Ponteus, John.

titleStmt.title: The true every man & woman their own doctor: or, a salve for every sore Being a book full of rare receipts for the most dangerous distempers incident to the bodies of men, women and children; and is very fit to be in all families against any time of sickness, gathered out of the library of that famous traveller Dr. Ponteus and now publish'd for the good and benefit of the kingdom; and being nothing but what is experienced by many thousands of people in city and country, doing good to many. Don't read only but practice also, then speak as you find; and give God the praise in all things. With six most excellent receipts for all sorts of cattle whatsoever. Licensed according to order.
titleStmt.author: Ponteus, John.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by F.L. for Matthias Drew, bo[ ] living in St. Sepulchres Church yard, and sold by himself, and [ ] living in Red-Lyon Court in White-cross-street,

notesStmt.note: Copy filmed at UMI microfilm Early English Books 1641-1700 reel tightly bound with pages mutilated, with some loss of imprint.
Reproduction of original in the Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine, London.
